name: Justice
overview: Justice is a British drama television series which originally aired on ITV in 39 hour-long episodes between 8 August 1971 and 16 October 1974. Margaret Lockwood stars as Harriet Peterson a female barrister in the North of England. It was made by Yorkshire Television and was based loosely on Justice Is a Woman, an episode of ITV Playhouse broadcast in 1969 in which Lockwood had previously also played a barrister. The theme music was Crown Imperial by William Walton.

episodes.name: The Most Important Thing of All
episodes.overview: Harriet represents her ex-husbands former cell mate after a bank robbery.

episodes.name: By Order of the Magistrates
episodes.overview: A decision must be made whether two children should remain with their mother or father.

episodes.name: Witnesses Cost Extra
episodes.overview: A defence lawyer is accused of buying witnesses.

episodes.name: The Rain It Raineth
episodes.overview: Three boys are involved injuring a security guard while breaking into a warehouse. One boy's case is treated separately after pleading guilty.

episodes.name: Within a Year and a Day
episodes.overview: If someone dies as a result of a previous crime the perpetrator can be tried for murder. Harriet must now defend Brian Parsons.

episodes.name: To Help an Old School Friend
episodes.overview: A conflict ensues between the the Cold war security state and the British legal system after a physicist is found dead.

episodes.name: No Flowers, by Request
episodes.overview: A gangster intimidates any potential witnesses to keep them from testifying about an assault.

episodes.name: When Did You First Feel the Pain?
episodes.overview: Harriet assists a doctor accused of prescribing a fatal drug.

episodes.name: A Nice Straightforward Treason
episodes.overview: A Soviet defector names one of Dr. Moody's patients as a Red Army Officer.

episodes.name: People Have Too Many Rights
episodes.overview: A policeman has a case brought against him by his superior accused of taking bribes.

episodes.name: You Didn't Have to Pay for Justice
A License to Build Your Own Money
episodes.overview: A large development project appeals against a decision to not build  on rural land.

episodes.name: A Duty to the Court
episodes.overview: A woman is accused of murder making Harriet wonder if she should submit possibly damaging evidence.

episodes.name: After All, What Is a Lie?
Covenant for Quiet Enjoyment
episodes.overview: Harriet tries to secure an appeal for her clerk's son.

episodes.name: Trial for Murder
episodes.overview: A wife is accused of poisoning her unwell husband.

episodes.name: The Fine Line of Duty
episodes.overview: Harriet assists in an industrial tribunal putting a politician in the spotlight over a chemical leak.

episodes.name: It's Always a Gamble
episodes.overview: Margaret helps a mentally ill young lady on probation who left a baby alone in a carriage.

episodes.name: Matrimonial Malice
episodes.overview: A doctor is accused by his wife of repeatedly assaulting her while he claims she is mentally disturbed.

episodes.name: Persona Non Grata
episodes.overview: Harriet tries to prove that a daughter of an American was involved in the theft of a painting, while Elliot tries to help an Indian student threatened with deportation.

episodes.name: Twice the Legal Limit
episodes.overview: Harriet Grudgingly defends a judge on a drink driving charge.

episodes.name: Under Suspicion
episodes.overview: Eliot is accused of bribing a Police Officer.

episodes.name: Decisions, Decisions
episodes.overview: An couple waste the courts time staging a marital disagreement for financial gain.
